children.subject: Are you claiming there's a way, or are you simply stating that we should be able to :)?

There's a way for grad students. There was a way for undergrad students in Summer 2020 to just enroll straight into CS C100 instead of Data C100. Not sure why they took away this option recently. I'm saying there should be a way to enroll straight into CS C100 like in the past if you're a declared CS student and not have to run around begging CS and DS enrollment & advisors to switch you.

Anyway, I'm waiting it out for them to start offering direct seats in CS C100 again to take the course.
Yeah I agree there should be a way. Is there a way though is the real question :) -- hence the post.

I think there's been a miscommunication here. The class known as Data 100 used to be cross-listed as both CS C100 and Stat C100, but it was never actually listed as Data C100 until Fall 2020. This has changed with the formation of CDSS and classes being offered by it; the class is now officially listed as Data C100, and it's all that undergrads will be able to enrol in. There isn't going to be an option to take it as CS C100 again, like Cindy mentioned. If you look at the academic guide for semesters including and after Fall 2020, there are 0 students enrolled in Stat C100 or CS C100.

Also: "There was a way for undergrad students in Summer 2020 to just enroll straight into CS C100 instead of Data C100." isn't accurate. Every student enrolled in CS C100 regardless of their individual preferences. It happened to be CS C100 because it was offered through the CS department in the summer. Undergrad students have never had the option of choosing what class they enrol in for a given semester
+1. Grad students could have either CS C200A or Stat C200 on their transcripts. There must be a way to take a CS course and get CS  notated on your transcript.

history.content:
As far as I know, moving forward for undergrads it’ll only be listed as DATA C100. Summer 2020 was (I think) the last offering of it as “CS C100” as “DATA C100” didn’t exist then.

for grad students it’s different since some programs (like the EECS 5th year MS) require you to be enrolled in a CS 2xx course to receive credit - but I don’t think that’s a thing for any undergrad program.

Re: summer CS classes - what's listed is all that we will offer this summer.

Re: CS C100 - the discussion I've seen is accurate.

For GRAD students only, DS allocates some open some seats for CS to manage in CS C200A so students can meet the requirements but the class is offered through Data Science (hence the DATA 200 designation).

For undergrads, there are no requirement issues, so all seats are offered and managed by Data Science. That means that DATA 100C is what will appear on your transcript. There is no way to change it to a CS designation.

children.subject: You are correct - at this time, no EE classes will be offered for SU21 nor do I expect any to be added to the schedule. That doesn't mean we won't - it simply means there currently are no plans to offer EE 16A or EE 16B.
Thank you! Do you know by when the official determination will happen?
I'm going to say that IS the official determination but I've learned to not make absolute statements because every once in a while faculty surprise me at the last minute. :-)
Are the EE classes listed all we will offer as well (e.g. we will not be offering 16A or 16B over the summer)?

history.content:
Are there going to be more CS classes published for Summer 2021?

Also, I signed up for DATA 100, and I'm wondering if that's any different than COMPSCI 100C? If this is the same class, I know this might sound trivial, but I would prefer COMPSCI 100C to show up on my transcript -- is this possible?

Thanks in advance :).
history.subject: Summer 2021 Classes
